lines.gurmukhi: jYsy eyk jnnI kY hoq hY Anyk suq sB hI mY AiDk ipAwro suq god ko
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Ayk Jananee Kai Hot Hai Anayk Souta , Sabh Hee Mai Adhik Piaaro Sout God Ko ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a mother has many sons but one in her lap is the dearest to her;

lines.gurmukhi: isAwny suq bnj ibauhwr ky bIcwr ibKY god mY Acyqu hyqu sMpY n shod ko
lines.transliteration_english: Siaanay Sout Banaj Biuhaar Kay Beechaar Bikhai , God Mai Achaytu Haytu Sanpai N Sahod Ko ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The elder sons remain engrossed in their commercial activities but one in lap is ignorant of all allurements of wealth, commodities and love of brothers and sisters;

lines.gurmukhi: plnw suvwie mwie giiH kwij lwgY jwie suin suq rudn pY pIAwvY mn mod ko
lines.transliteration_english: Palanaa Suvaai Maai Grihi Kaaji Laagai Jaai , Souni Sout Rudan Pai Peeaavai Man Mod Ko ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Leaving the innocent baby in a cradle, the mother keeps attending other domestic chores but listening to the baby's cry, she comes running and feeds the child.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpw Koie joeI gur crin srin ghy rhy inrdoK moK And ibnod ko ]392]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapaa Khoi Joee Gur Charani Sarani Gahay , Rahay Niradokh Mokh Anad Binod Ko ?392?

Shabad OS B.translation: Like the innocent child, he who loses his self and takes the refuge of the holy feet of the True Guru, is blessed with the consecration of Naam-Simran-Mantar that saves him from the worldly vices; and relishing the bliss of Naam Simran he achieves salvati
